description: With tightened regulations for medical marijuana, laws defining grow cooperatives are changing. Old laws didn’t say whether or not all patients in a collective needed to actively participate in the growing process. (Photo by Kathryn Boyd-Batstone | News21)
New laws mean grow collectives are only allowed to provide for a maximum of four patients, each of whom must participate in the growing process. (Photo by Kathryn Boyd-Batstone | New21)
If collective grows don't follow the new participation laws for medical marijuana, they could face fines and jail time. (Photo by Kathryn Boyd-Batstone | News 21)
